pages.text: Are you getting frustrated by the large range of your $(l:mechanics/prospecting)Prospector's Pick$()? Tired of digging around clueless as to the location of your riches? Well, despair no more, for a $(thing)Prospector's Hammer$() or $(thing)Prospector's Drill$() may be able to help!

pages.title: Prospector's Hammer
pages.text: The Prospector's Hammer is a near copy of its pick-y brother, with the notable exception of a smaller range, only searching the 13x13x13 area centered on the block inspected. Very useful for finding veins that appear to be all around you.

Much like with a Prospector's Pick, a Prospector's Hammer Head Mold can be made by $(l:getting_started/pottery)knapping$() some clay, as shown above, which can be heated and used to $(l:getting_started/finding_ores#casting)cast$() liquid metal.

A Prospector's Hammer Head can also be $(l:mechanics/anvils#working)smithed$() out of a $(thing)double ingot$() of any tool metal on an $(l:mechanics/anvils)Anvil$(). Craft the tool head with a stick to make a Prospector's Hammer.

pages.title: Prospector's Drill
pages.text: If you're unsure of which direction a vein is in, it may be time to pull out a $(thing)Prospector's Drill$(). It searches a 7x25x7 area, with the long side being in-line with the clicked block side, centered 10 blocks away.
A Prospector's Drill Head Mold can be knapped from clay as seen above.
A Prospector's Drill Head can also be smithed out of a tuyere of any tool metal on an Anvil.
Craft the tool head with a pair of sticks to make a Prospector's Drill.
Keep in mind that it may be rare to see a Prospector's Hammer or Drill report finding a $(thing)Very Large Sample$(), due to their smaller range of inspection.
